Fields.DialogueText: *Bark* (It is nice to feel the grass on my paws for once.)
Churchill seems to be enjoying himself as well!
Thank you for joining me for a walk, Captain. With such little time off the ship, Churchill rarely gets to stretch his legs this often.
It's such a pleasant day, I couldn't very well turn down such an offer.

Fields.MenuText: Have you always held a penchant for animals?
Are you a cat person or a dog person?
Have you ever cared for a pet before?

Fields.DialogueText: Most definitely. I suppose they remind me of myself in a way.
Captain! I couldn't answer that question in front of the present company. Were I to favor cats, Churchill would be offended. Yet, if I were to say dogs he would think me pandering!
Never! I always wanted to have an animal companion by my side!
Look at those clouds. We'd best be returning to the ship. It looks like a storm is coming.
That isn't all that's coming, Captain! Take a look out to sea.
Morganas! What kind of pathetic fallacy is this? Let's show them what a real storm looks like!
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
Ursula! I thought I'd find you out here! Standing in the rain again, I see.
It's wonderful, Captain! I could stand out here for hours!
Luckily, I bought a new umbrella while we were docked.
You shouldn't have bothered, Captain, I'm perfectly comfortable as--
It's for me, actually.
For you?
You looked lonely standing out here by yourself! None of the crew are confident enough to brave such weather so I must shoulder the responsibility of keeping you company!
Captain, you shouldn't go to such lengths, you're much more prone to sickness than--
I'll hear no more of it. Now, tell me what entrances you so much about…

Fields.MenuText: The stormy sea.
The rain.
Forcing your superiors into such situations.

Fields.DialogueText: It's entrancing, Captain. Each crashing wave looks as if it could reside in a frame and hang in the National Gallery. Once all the paintings are returned there post-war of course.
As though I'm a budding flower it breathes fresh new life into me. I can't quite describe it.
You're welcome to come and go as you please. Although, I will admit, it's nice having someone to talk to…
*REEEEEAK*
What was that?
It looks like the storm is picking up.
*ALARM*
Morganas!
They must be trying to take advantage of the stormy seas and ambush us!
Let's give them a little reminder as to why we shouldn't be taken so lightly.
@BATTLE
Phew! What a battle!
Poseidon must be a pacifist because we appear to have angered him. This storm is becoming too much even for me!
*CRASH*
What happened?!
That hatch just flew open!
No! I forgot to lock my room!
*CRASH*
My umbrellas!
Why are they all open?!
I enjoy looking at the designs!
You've made it easier for the wind to carry them along! You should know more than anyone that it's bad luck to open an umbrella indoors!
*SPLASH*
Captain! I have to go after them!

Fields.MenuText: Are you mad, woman?
Leaping into such waters is suicide!
You'll never be able to swim against such a current!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm a submarine! I was built for it.
*ALARM*
Perfect timing! I can take out these Morganas from below while I collect the umbrellas!
Ursula, wait!
Don't try and stop me, Captain. You wouldn't understand.
*SPLOOSH*
Ursula…
@BATTLE
Ursula! Can you hear me?!
BWAH! Captain! I've recovered most of them but I can barely move. I've spent all my energy.
Here, I'll throw down a rope!
Thank you.
*Thud*
*Pant* *pant*
Ursula… I didn't realize how much those umbrellas meant to you.
They are my treasured possessions. Each one represents a happy memory I've made standing aboard this ship.

Fields.MenuText: What does the red umbrella remind you of?
What does the blue umbrella remind you of?
What does the yellow umbrella remind you of?

Fields.DialogueText: The red umbrella was destroyed during the night of our first meeting. The night was long and wet and I stood out here to think over my duties going forward.
The blue umbrella lost its life sometime after we picked Churchill up. Thanks in part to a storm but not how you might think. The thunder scared him into chewing it up!
The yellow umbrella was a gift from my sisters. It became irreparable during a storm like any other. However, I'll always remember where it came from.
Do you have a favorite umbrella?
Of course. My favorite is a black one I received after completing my first mission. I'll never forget that feeling of accomplishment and…
Something wrong?
The black umbrella! It's not here!
That can't be right, you collected… oh no.
What is it?
I think I can see it floating away.
No! Captain, I'm too weak to move! I can't believe I'll have to part with it…
Not on my watch, you won't!
Captain, what are you… why are you taking off… you can't possibly want to brave such a horrendous-- Captain!
*SPLISH*
*ALARM*
Handle…*blub* those Morganas for me *glub* while I *gulp* grab the umbrella.
I'll need reinforcements to cover me while I recharge a spell. Men! To your positions!
@BATTLE
There's the Captain! Quickly, throw the life raft!
*SPLOSH*
Pull! Come on, that's the Captain out there!
*Thud*
Captain… Captain!
No, no, no, Captain, you can't let it end like this.
Captain! You jerk! You promised you would take Churchill and I for a walk during our next outing!
If you're the kind of captain who would break such a vow then don't bother returning from the afterlife!
Captain… please…
*splutter* *choke* *cough*
Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Make sure… you don't open these inside anymore.
I must have died and gone to heaven to be met with such an angel.
I think I swallowed a jellyfish.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain… *sniff* Why did you do that?
I guess... my feelings for you are... the same as your feelings for the umbrellas. You're... my... treasure...
*Thud*
Quickly! Get the doctor!
*Footsteps*
Captain… you idiot…
How are you feeling, Captain?
Much better! I'm surprised I only got off with a slight concussion! That storm was biblical!
Promise me you'll never do something so insanely reckless ever again!
You pull crazy stunts all the time! In fact, you were the one who dives in first!
That's different!
How so?
Well, firstly, I am made to traverse the sea without any issue. Secondly, I have no qualms expunging my own life but I couldn't continue in a world that didn't include--
Ursula?
Give me a second, Captain. I'm having trouble finishing this sentence.
Okay…?
I couldn't live in a world where I wasn't standing beside--
What's the problem?
It's strange. I know what I want to say but… each time I try to push it past my lips, my bodily functions shut down.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you swallowed a fish while diving for your umbrellas.
You never usually have trouble telling me how you feel. For better or worse…
Are you trying to say something different than what you would normally say?

Fields.DialogueText: By the size of the catch in my throat, it would have had to have been a puffer fish but I don't think they're native to these waters.
Captain, you're knock-knock jokes are lacklustre at best. No, it seems that part of my brain is still functioning without issue.
Yes. I'm trying to… to… I can't explain it either?!
*ALARM*
Maybe a fiery battle will ignite your ability to speak again.
I hope so, Captain. This is all very peculiar…
@BATTLE
Oh, Churchill. I've been feeling so strange recently.
*Bark* (How so, Ursula?)
Ever since Captain told me all those things, whenever we lock eyes my heart can't stop pounding.
*Ruff* (Is that so?)
My hands get sweaty and I become a blubbering mess.
*Wan* (It truly is a mystery…)
Do you think I've contracted something?
*BARK* (What an absolute fool you are. You're in love, Girl! Love!)
I hope I don't infect the Captain…
Ursula! There you are! I have something for you.
Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Guess what's behind my back.
I know you were feeling down lately.
I made a little impromptu purchase.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, we are at war. We don't have time for these… is that some kind of fabric I see? You got me a Madame Isobel dress?!
No, Captain, it isn't that I've been feeling sad. It's hard to explain.
You didn't need to go that far for me.
Ta-da! Look, a new umbrella.
Captain…
I know it doesn't have any sentimental value but I figured it could kick-start a brand new, less water-logged, collection for you.
Cap...tain…
Ursula? Are you okay, you're holding your throat as if suffering an allergic reaction.
*Bark* (Come on, Girl. Say how you feel).
*ALARM*
Morganas! Ursula, you'll have to catch me up later. For now, we have to get ready.
Yes, Captain…
@BATTLE
What is this, Churchill? A picture of the Captain? Where on earth did you find this?
And along with it, you've brought me... roses?
You know we need those for finding other Belles. For focusing our hearts...
*Bark* (Heart, Captain. Heart, Captain. This isn't brain surgery!)
Churchill!
*Ruff* (And the penny drops.)
Are you implying that this is why I've been having difficulty talking with the Captain recently?
*BARK*
There's no way this is possible… I am a professional! I wouldn't let such feelings affect my--
*ALARM*
Ursula, there you are! Morganas!

Fields.MenuText: Can you lend me your assistance?
I need you!
Will you stand by me?

Fields.DialogueText: I… Morgana… kill now.
Great! I'll see you upstairs!
*Sigh* Thank you for enlightening me, Churchill…
@BATTLE
I've never felt like this before, Churchill. I've never felt… ANYTHING before!
I've had smatterings of happiness waft over me now and again. Even after meeting the Captain, I've experienced those known feelings occasionally.
But this, this is an entirely new beast altogether. I didn't know that someone like myself was capable of feeling such emotion.
*BARK* (Ursula… I never realized you were such a tormented soul…)
Oh, Churchill. If only there were a way to convey these mixed emotions to the Captain.
*BARK* (Leave it with me, Ursula! I'll get you two together as if my life depends on it!)
Churchill! Where are you going?!
Whoa! Churchill, easy there, you nearly took me out. He's in a hurry.
We were just talking and he suddenly bolted off. I wonder what he's up to.

Fields.MenuText: You were... talking?
Did he tell you anything interesting?
Is Churchill a chatterbox?

Fields.DialogueText: There's nothing strange about that, Captain. Animals are just as intelligent as us.
To be honest, our conversations are a little one-sided.
Quite the opposite, he's a wonderful listener.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Hopefully, Churchill's barks inspired some fight within you.
Rest assured, Captain, I can spur such momentum all on my own!
@BATTLE
Ursula? What are you doing here?
Churchill led me down here, Captain.
Me too. I was in the Bridge but his barking was relentless.
He did the same with me. I thought that there may have been some kind of emergency.
What's that on the floor by your desk, Captain?
It looks like your picnic basket. The one you prepared for your walk with Churchill during our next Dock.
How did that get there…?
Looks like we may have a ghost aboard the ship.
I'll take it away at once, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Well…
Seeing as it's already here…
It would be a shame if…

Fields.DialogueText: Captain?
Would you like to join me for an impromptu dinner, Ursula?
Y-yes...p-please…
*ALARM*
Shoot! Let's take out these Morganas quickly and then return to our meal.
@BATTLE
This is a wonderful meal, Ursula. Did you prepare all this food yourself?
Y-yes...Captain. But it was no trouble at all!
It's positively divine! You're going to make someone very happy someday.
W-w-w-what on Earth are you talking about! I am a lethal weapon capable of dismantling entire fleets by myself! Do you think I would be satisfied preparing meals all day?
I didn't mean any offense. I just think you'd make a great wife.
*MENTAL EXPLOSION*
Ursula? Ursula?! Are you, OK?! You've gone bright red!
Captain, I feel incredibly light-headed.

Fields.MenuText: Can I get you some water?
Do you need a cold compress?
Shall I take you to your bedroom?

Fields.DialogueText: My mouth is rather dry but I fear no amount of water could moisturize it at present.
Anything placed on my forehead at present would almost instantly melt I do fear.
*MENTAL EXPLOSION*
*MENTAL EXPLOSION*
*MENTAL EXPLOSION*
I'll be fine, Captain! Please, don't touch me. I… I just… I need to figure some things out on my own.
Oh, I see. Well, if there's anything I can do to help.
No need, Captain! Just give me some time! Okay…?
Of course, whatever you need.
*ALARM*
You'll excuse me if I don't offer the same courtesy to these Morganas!
@BATTLE
Captain! Come quickly, it's an emergency!
What is it, Ursula?!
It's Churchill! He won't stop coughing and he looks so ill!
*ALARM*
Leave him to me, I'll arrange a bed for him while you take out these Morganas.
@BATTLE
What do you think could be the matter with him? He was spry as ever only days before.
I'm not sure. Best to let him get some rest for now.
Will you help me take care of him, Captain?
Of course, Ursula, I won't leave either of your sides.
*ba...ark* (Hehehe. Now, forced to stay together, Ursula might finally be able to confess her feelings. Oh, Churchill, you master tactician! You certainly live up to your namesake, don't you?)

Fields.MenuText: Have you ever taken care of an ailing patient before?
Do Belles get sick?
With the right nurse's outfit you'd look just like Florence Nightingale, wouldn't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Never. As you know, I am the youngest of three sisters so I was always treated first whenever we fell ill.
Not in the same way humans do. Occasionally, we burn out due to fatigue but the symptoms are reminiscent of illness.
Should you have a nurse's outfit readily available, Captain, I'd have to question your moral standing…
He looks hot, I'm going to run a cold compress over his forehead.
I think you're being a little rough. See, he's flinching with every rub.
*bark…* (FREEZING!)
Here, let me help you. Gently, like this.
Captain… you're holding my hand…
It can't be helped, I need to show you what to do.
Captain… while I have you… there's been something on my mind as of late.
Oh? Do let me know.
*Bark* (here it comes!)
I… I… I!
*Rumble grumble rumble*
Was that…? Churchill, are you hungry?
He must be feeling better! I'll get him something to eat immediately.
*Bark* (Curse this insatiable canine hunger of mine… I hope she brings back a steak…)
You two certainly look busy! What's all the ruckus about?
Captain, it's incredible! Before, Churchill had only mastered the "stay" command. But, look at this.
Whoa! He's standing upright!
And look, if I take his paws… it's like we're dancing.
*RUFF* (OW!)
Oh, sorry, Churchill! My two left feet can barely keep up without stepping on your paws.

Fields.MenuText: You never learned how to dance, Ursula?
Are you interested in dancing?
UK people aren't slouches when it comes to dancing, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Forgive me for this gap in my knowledge, Captain, but I truly thought there was no need.
Ballroom dancing is infinitely fascinating to me. Although, I prefer upbeat rhythms seen in Salsa.
Well, Morris dancing is the native dance for Scotland and Wales but it doesn't have the same appeal as a nice Waltz.
I can teach you how to dance.
Captain?
Yeah, I've had to attend a ball or two over the course of my career. Besides, we can't have poor Churchill being stepped on all day.
*ALARM*
Come down to my quarters after we take care of these Morganas!
@BATTLE
One, two, one, two.
One, two, one, two.
Ow!
Sorry!
It's okay. You're getting better. Let's try it again.
You're much better than I thought you'd be, Captain.
Thank you kindly.
I wouldn't be surprised if you told me you had taken professional lessons.

Fields.MenuText: These basic steps are easy enough for anyone to master.
This dance is quite simple.
It's really nothing special.

Fields.DialogueText: No, it's great, I'm… having fun.
Did you finally figure out whatever it is you've been trying to tell me yet?
No, but… I feel like, as each day passes, it's getting easier and easier.
*ALARM*
What say we treat these Morganas to a little tango?
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
You're up early today, Ursula.
Did I wake you, Captain? I thought I would get in a little light training before the rest of the crew woke up.
No, it's fine - I was on my way to find some food anyway. What are you up to?
To sharpen my aim with a torpedo, I've taken up archery.
Is that really necessary?
I won't delve into the details of my previous transgressions, but… it does help quite a bit.
HYA!
Whoa! Bullseye!
Thank you, Captain. Would you like a turn?
Sure!
As repayment for teaching me to dance, I'd be happy to lend some assistance. Did you have any probing questions?

Fields.MenuText: Am I holding it right?

Fields.DialogueText: Lift your shoulder a little… and don't arch your back.

Fields.MenuText: How long have you been archery training?

Fields.DialogueText: Goodness, as long as I can remember. Were I to run into the Huns I'd be perfectly capable of returning fire!

Fields.MenuText: Do you do any other training?

Fields.DialogueText: I complete the same standard daily training as any other Belle. However, you'd be surprised how many of us are proficient in traditional weapons as well.
OOF!
Hmm. You hit the board but that score isn't going to be making any headlines.
It's hopeless, huh?
Hardly. Let me give you a hand.
*ALARM*
Perhaps I can show you better than I can tell you.
Lead the way, Robin Hood!
@BATTLE
Okay, Captain. Inhale, line up the shot, and then release as you exhale.
Huuuuu
HA!
Bullseye! Amazing!
I did it!
And it only took forty-seven failed attempts!
I wish you'd leave that part out…
Perhaps we could compete in a friendly competition.
What did you have in mind?
One round with three arrows each. The winner is whoever can score the most points.
Interesting. I'd need some time to practice but what's on the line here?
I'm fine with receiving no prize. I am the veteran here after all. Is there anything in particular that you want?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe a foot massage.

Fields.DialogueText: I just got a rather disturbing shiver up my spine. I fear some incarnation of me somewhere has been forced to live through such a horrific ordeal.
I didn't realize you were such a high-stakes gambler, Captain. I suppose I could give you £1 a day for the next 1000 days.

Fields.MenuText: Your hidden stash of Locust berries.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not that much of a farmer, as you know. I fear that you don't know what you're in for should I offer them up to you.
How about you finally tell me what's been on your mind recently?
I would if I could but I find myself still unable to--
"I find myself unable to…" In all my time knowing you, never once have I found you give up so easily.
Captain?
Aren't you the same Ursula who defeats Morganas on a daily basis?
Yes, but--
And the same Ursula who, instead of accepting her fate, dived headfirst into a stormy sea to retrieve her umbrellas?
You're absolutely right. Very well, if you can trounce me in a best of three, I'll lay everything bare.
*ALARM*
Perfect! Target practice delivered straight to my doorstep!
@BATTLE
Hard at work, I see.
You've lit a fire in me. I feel like Cupid hunting people down in hopes of creating mayhem.
Was Cupid such a terrifying figure?
Oh yes. Our modern idea of Cupid has been romanticized a great deal.
Fascinating.
In fact, most of the films by Walt Disney have been taken from a traditional book of tales by the Brother's Grimm.
I had no idea.
Those stories are much more dreadful than anything Disney puts up on the big screen.
I may have to study them sometime.
It got me thinking. You live somewhat of a double life, don't you?
How so?
Well, to the crew and your sisters, you try to emulate perfection.
True. I don't want the crew to think of me as a younger sibling and I try to live up to my family's expectations.
But to me, you laugh, cry, shout, boast. It must be tiring.
I never thought about it like that.

Fields.MenuText: Do you prefer either life?
Is it tricky to balance.
It sounds stressful.

Fields.DialogueText: There is certainly less stress, ironically, when I'm with the crew or my sisters. I rarely show emotion to them and it results in few heated discussions.
Well, I'm grateful that you can let your hair down a little even if it's only for a short duration.
*ALARM*
I think it's time we let down the sails of these Morganas ships as well!
@BATTLE
Okay, Captain. Time to put all that training to use.
I'm ready whenever you are.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
First, let's take care of these Morganas. I'm sure we can spare an arrow or two!
I'll go first. HA! HA! HA!
Two out of three bullseyes. Not too shabby.
You're up, Captain.
HA!
Good job!
That's one bullseye! How about another?! HA!
That's two!
I can do this…
I believe in you, Captain. You were the one who saw something in me when no one else did. Show them they were wrong to not trust in my abilities!
HA!
Bullseye! You win!
Phew! That was more stressful than any Morgana I've encountered to date!
Congratulations!
You know what that means, right?
Hm?
I can finally hear what's been on your mind.
A deal is a deal. Although, give me just a little more time. I need to collect my thoughts.
Of course, Ursula.
(Good day, Ladies and gentlemen. Your friendly neighborhood naval pooch, Churchill here.)
(We're finally closing in on Ursula's confession but it looks as though she's going to need a little more help from yours truly.)
(As much as I may have pressured her in the past, we can all see how hard she's trying. Let's give her one last encouraging cheer.)
(I've got a great plan lined up ready to assist Ursula as best I can.)
(Hopefully, this time, she can find the words she's been looking for.)
Doesn't Churchill look lost in thought, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I wonder what's going on in that head of his.
I wonder if he's daydreaming.
He looks more focused than I do during a battle!

Fields.DialogueText: He's probably thinking about the thick juicy steak I've prepared for his tea tonight.
(Were I able to articulate myself to Ursula, she would have surely reached a logical conclusion weeks ago.)
(Alas, bound to this animalistic four-legged vessel, I can do naught but work with what I've been given.)
(Don't give up, Ursula. And neither will I.)
*Bark!*
He's so cute, isn't he, Captain?
*ALARM*
Morganas! Don't worry, Churchill! Mommy will protect you!
*Ruff* (If she only knew…)
@BATTLE
Okay, Churchill, go ahead. I'll let you off the lead for a while.
*Ruff!*
He's as energetic as ever, huh?
It's times like these that motivate me to keep fighting. If I can fight to protect these moments, I'll do everything in my power to emerge victoriously.

Fields.MenuText: Does this Dock remind you of the UK?

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps it would if the current weather was a torrential downpour!

Fields.MenuText: What will you do after your service concludes?

Fields.DialogueText: I think I'd like to return to my sisters. I'm looking forward to showing them the woman I've become.

Fields.MenuText: With you on the side of justice, I don't see how we could lose!

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate the compliment but it's too soon to be complacent. The Morganas could strike at any time.
*ALARM*
It looks as though you'll get a chance to protect this moment in particular!
Morganas, on approach!
Churchill! Quickly come back!
*BORK*
Here, let's both marvel at how strong your mommy is!
@BATTLE
Nothing like a piping hot meal after a hard day's work.
I couldn't agree more, Captain. The cuisine on ship is surprisingly good considering our lack of resources.

Fields.MenuText: Are there any famous foods in the UK?
What say you to the stereotype of seasoning being a thing of legend in the UK.
Do you have a favorite dish?

Fields.DialogueText: Unlike the rest of the world, we don't really have a native dish. Fish and chips would probably come the closest.
They're not wrong. Compared to other countries, our food may seem a little bland. Although, in my opinion, food is delicious enough by itself. I don't need anything more.
That's tricky. Locust berries are my favourite snack but, as for a meal, I could never turn down a Sunday roast dinner followed by a Full English breakfast!
*BARK BARK*
What is it, Churchill? The Captain and I were just about to start our evening meal.
*BARK BARK*
Whatever it is, it sounds serious. I think he wants us to follow him.
*ALARM*
Okay, Churchill, we'll follow you as soon as we've taken out these Morganas!
@BATTLE
Why did you drag us all the way down here, boy?
*BARK*
What is…?
That looks like the umbrella I salvaged from the waters during the storm.
It is, isn't it? Why did you bring that down here, Churchill?
*BARK*
What a crazy day that was, huh?
I thought I'd lost you for good, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I'd never seen you with so many tears in your eyes before!
I thought you were going to cry!

Fields.DialogueText: It can't be helped! It felt as though the dam surrounding my heart had sprung a leak!
Well, I'm glad I can make you feel something at least.
*BARK*
We're not done here? Okay, boy, take us to the next location.
*ALARM*
Right after we defeat these Morganas, that is.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I still feel bad about that. You took it pretty hard.

Fields.DialogueText: My quarters?
Look! The picnic basket is still in here.
So, it is. That was delicious, wasn't it?
I don't remember much of that day to be honest. You wouldn't stop spouting nonsense the entire time…
This is where I taught you to dance as well.
Churchill and I both thank you for that. I don't step on your paws anymore, do I?
*BARK*

Fields.MenuText: We've certainly come a long way, haven't we?

Fields.DialogueText: That we have.

Fields.MenuText: We've made so many memories.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll be sure to cherish them forever.

Fields.MenuText: Would you change any of our journeys if you could?

Fields.DialogueText: Not a thing. For all the mishaps we experienced led us to this moment.
*BARK*
Is this the last time, Churchill?
*BARK*
Good. We can't keep running behind you all day.
*ALARM*
Especially when there's Morganas to fight. Captain! With me!
@BATTLE
What has all this been about, Churchill?
*BARK*
What's that he's holding. Is that the picture of me from my graduation ceremony?
This was on the desk in my quarters. How did he come across that?
Don't be angry at Churchill, Captain. Yes, he was the one who stole it but, I knew about it and never came forward.

Fields.MenuText: Why would you do that?
Did you need a picture of me in my youth so badly?
Am I that dashing in the photo?

Fields.DialogueText: Churchill brought me this photo to help me realize something.
Oh?
Something that had been building inside me for a long time.
The thought you can't express.
Exactly. Although, thanks to Churchill, I think I'm finally ready.
I'm all ears.
Captain… I… l--
*ALARM*
*Sigh* It just wasn't meant to be, huh, Churchill. You run along downstairs while we take care of these Morganas.
@BATTLE
Captain… When we're together, I feel emotions I thought weren't possible for someone like me.
I feel the same way, Ursula.
You do? That... that makes me so happy.
*ALARM*
Ugh! Can't these Morganas see that I'm trying to have a moment here?! Captain, please assist me!
@BATTLE
Now, finally, what I wanted to say; what I've been trying to say this whole time.
Captain! I have feelings for you! I... request permission to attempt courtship!

Fields.MenuText: Whoa…
That's a lot to take in at once…
I'm not sure how to respond…

Fields.DialogueText: It's okay, Captain. Even just saying it feels as though a weight has been lifted. Whatever your response is, I--
Ursula!
Captain! Y-y-you're grabbing my hand!
You make out like you're some callous robot incapable of feeling emotions but I don't buy it one bit!
Captain?
You're as emotional as any one of us but you're just afraid to show it! I can see that I'm the right person to bring out that side of you.
What are you saying?
I'm saying that it looks like you're going to need my help for the foreseeable future in drawing out that caramel center.
And so?
Permission to court granted. I'm looking forward to it.
Ah! I'll inform Churchill of our new relationship status! I hope he doesn't get too jealous!
So, that established... what say we sail into the sunset?
Yes, Captain!
*EPILOGUE*
(And so, the curtain closes on this chapter of Ursula's great love affair. This is Churchill the dog signing off and wishing all of you out there a happy love life.)
(Oh, and the next time you're having girl trouble, why not confide in your own pooch? They might have more to offer than would first appear.)
